forbid.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed
forbid.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The law strictly forbids racial or sexual discrimination.
He was forbidden to leave the house, as a punishment.
Women are forbidden from going out without a veil.
forbid.translation[0].definitions[0].not: In everyday English, people usually say that someone is not allowed to do something rather than is forbidden to do something:
He was not allowed to leave the house.
forbid.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to make it impossible for someone to do something
forbid.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Lack of space forbids listing the names of all those who contributed.
forbid.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: forbid
to tell someone in a very strong way that they must not do something or that something is not allowed
His doctor had strictly forbidden him to drink alcohol.
It is forbidden to say such things.
not allow
to say that someone must not do or have something, and stop them doing or having it
The company does not allow smoking inside the building.
Mobile phones are not allowed in school.
not let
to not allow someone to do something. Not let  is more informal than not allow
My parents wonâ€™t let me stay out later than 11 o'clock.
not permit
if something is not permitted, a rule or law says that you must not do it. Not permit  is more formal than not allow
Candidates are not permitted to use dictionaries in this examination.
Parking is not permitted here after 8 am.
ban
to say officially that people must not do or have something
Parliament decided to ban fox-hunting.
The book was banned in many countries.
prohibit
to say officially that an action is illegal and make a law or rule about this
Acts of vandalism are prohibited.
bar
to not allow someone to enter a place or do something, especially by preventing it officially
Foreign journalists were barred from entering the country.
proscribe
to say officially that people are not allowed to do something
The law proscribes discrimination in the workplace.
